meanings.definition: A person who advocates for voluntary interactions and opposes coercion in all forms.
meanings.sent1: The voluntaryist always promotes peaceful agreements and dislikes forceful actions.
meanings.sent2: As a voluntaryist, she believes in choosing to work together without being forced.
meanings.sent3: The voluntaryist joked that even cats should have the freedom to decide when to be petted.
meanings.sent4: In a world of mandatory rules, the voluntaryist stands out like a bright beacon of choice.
meanings.sent5: The image of the voluntaryist is like a gentle breeze in a world of storms, advocating for freedom of will.

meanings.definition: One who believes in voluntary cooperation and voluntary solutions to societal problems.
meanings.sent1: Being a voluntaryist means valuing teamwork and choosing solutions willingly.
meanings.sent2: The voluntaryist community thrives on the idea of working together by choice.
meanings.sent3: The voluntaryist humorously suggested solving traffic jams by everyone deciding to drive in reverse.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of compulsory actions, the voluntaryist sails with the wind of voluntary collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a voluntaryist is like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the bigger picture of society.
